title: XMLRPC, Enabling XPSA and Bruteforce and DOS + A file disclosing installer-logs.
content:
Summary:
[XMLRPC+Installer_logs+Backup_Filename+Admin_username+disclosure]
Steps To Reproduce:
I was able to successfully exploit XMLRPC with the traditional method, the brute-force was done the username was there in the Installer Logs
path to XMLRPC is http://13.92.255.102/xmlrpc.php + the username is in https://lonestarcell.com/installer-log.txt
Pingback ping can be used to dos the target server when mishandled ## Supporting Material/References: I was able to reproduce this whole https://www.netsparker.com/blog/web-security/xml-rpc-protocol-ip-disclosure-attacks/
Impact
1)Automated once from multiple hosts and be used to cause a mass DDOS attack on the victim.
2) This method is also used for brute force attacks to stealing the admin credentials and other important credentials
3) File disclosure is causing most harm as internal criticals are popping out
steps: Access the XMLRPC endpoint at http://13.92.255.102/xmlrpc.php
Retrieve the admin username from the disclosed installer logs at https://lonestarcell.com/installer-log.txt
Use the retrieved username to perform a brute-force attack via XMLRPC
Exploit the pingback feature in XMLRPC to conduct a Denial of Service (DOS) attack
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves multiple security issues including XMLRPC exploitation for brute-force attacks and Denial of Service (DOS), along with sensitive information disclosure via installer logs. The XMLRPC endpoint allows for brute-force attacks once the admin username is obtained from the publicly accessible installer logs. Additionally, the pingback feature in XMLRPC can be misused to launch DOS attacks.
reason: The attack involves multiple components (XMLRPC exploitation, information disclosure from logs, brute-forcing, and DOS) but each step is straightforward and well-documented in security literature. The interactions between components are not subtle, and the attack does not require manipulating complex application states or novel logic.
